intro: Parosela urceolata, commonly known as the urn-shaped moss, is a species of moss that belongs to the family Dicranaceae. It is characterized by its dense, cushion-like growth form and dark green, glossy leaves that are often curved. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its spore-producing structures, called capsules, are borne on short, erect stems and are often reddish in color. Parosela urceolata plays an important role in soil stabilization and moisture retention in its native habitats.
